title: ICE: cfi:  encode_ty: unexpected `Param(B/#1)`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code `rustc -Clto -Zsanitizer=cfi` ```Rust trait Stream { type Item; } impl<'a> Stream for &'a str { type Item = u8; } fn f<'s>(s: &'s str) -> (&'s str, <&'s str as Stream>::Item) { (s, 42) } fn main() { let fx = f as for<'t> fn(&'t str) -> (&'t str, <&'t str as Stream>::Item); assert_eq!(fx("hi"), ("hi", 42)); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (0b795044c 2023-05-12) binary: rustc commit-hash: 0b795044c6f0854445f1f2bb6443e87848e150d1 commit-date: 2023-05-12 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.71.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_symbol_mangling/src/typeid/typeid_itanium_cxx_abi.rs:685:13: encode_ty: unexpected `Param(B/#1)` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/0b795044c6f0854445f1f2bb6443e87848e150d1/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1650:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fefb9d99051 -
